meanings.definition: A physical form or body assumed by a deity or spirit.
meanings.sent1: In some stories, gods take on different incarnations to walk among humans.
meanings.sent2: The ancient texts describe the various incarnations of the divine being.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a cat having multiple incarnations as a human is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an incarnation of pure love that touched everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the essence of nature's incarnations in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: A particular version or manifestation of a person or idea.
meanings.sent1: Each generation brings forth new incarnations of fashion trends.
meanings.sent2: The film industry often presents different incarnations of classic characters.
meanings.sent3: The incarnations of his favorite superhero in different costumes made him chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an incarnation of joy that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The changing seasons are nature's beautiful incarnations of time passing by.
